roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses
Class Robot

java.lang.Object
  roboRallyPackage.Terminatable
      roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses.Element
          roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses.Robot
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEnergyHolder
public class Robot
extends Element
implements IEnergyHolder

A class representing robots.

Version:
24 may 2012
Author:
Jonas Schouterden (r0260385) & Nele Rober (r0262954) Bachelor Ingenieurswetenschappen, KULeuven
Invariants:
  • The orientation of each robot must be a valid orientation.
        Robot.canHaveAsOrientation(this.getOrientation())
  • The total weight of the items a robot can carry must not exceed the maximum weight it can carry.
        this.getTotalWeightToCarry() <= getMaxWeightToCarry()
  • An item that this robot is carrying cannot have a Board or a Position
        for each item in this.getPossessions(): item.getBoard() == null && item.getPosition() == null
  • A robot cannot carry a terminated item
        for each item in this.getPossessions().size(): ! item.isTerminated()
  • A terminated Robot cannot carry any items or alter its state.
        if this.isTerminated() then this.getPossessions().size() == 0

    Constructor Detail

    Robot

    public Robot(Position position,
             Board board,
             Orientation orientation,
             double currentEnergy,
             double maxEnergy)
    Initialize this new robot with given position, board, orientation, currentEnergy [Ws] and maxEngery [Ws].

    Parameters:
    position - The position for this new robot.
    board - The board on which this new robot is placed.
    orientation - The orientation for this new robot.
    currentEnergy - The current energy level for this new robot, expressed in watt-second [Ws].
    maxEnergy - The maximum amount of energy this new robot can ever have, expressed in watt-second [Ws].
    Postcondition:
    If the value of maxEnergy, expressed in watt-second [Ws], is a valid value, the new maximum energy level of this new robot is set to this value (in Ws).
        if(canHaveAsMaxEnergy(maxEnergy)) then (new this).getMaxEnergy == maxEnergy
    Effects:
  • This new robot is initialized as an Element with the given position and board.
        super(position, board)
  • The new orientation of this new robot is equal to the given orientation.
        this.setOrientation(orientation)
  • The new current energy of this new robot is equal to the given current energy, expressed in watt-second [Ws], if this is a valid value for current energy.
        if(canHaveAsEnergy(currentEnergy) then this.setEnergy(currentEnergy)

    • Robot

    public Robot()
    Create a new robot with standard values.

    Effect:
    Initialize the robot with standard values
        this(null,null,Orientation.RIGHT,0,20000)
    Method Detail

    terminate

    public void terminate()
    Terminates this robot. All its possessions are also terminated and removed from the robots list.

    Overrides:
    terminate in class Element
    Postconditions:
  • This robot is terminated
        (new this).isTerminated()
  • All the elements of this robot are terminated
        for each item in this.getPossessions(): (new this).isTerminated
  • All the elements this robot possesses are removed from the list that keeps these items
        (new this).getPossessions().size() == 0

    canHaveAsOrientation

    public static final boolean canHaveAsOrientation(Orientation orientation)
    Checks whether the given orientation is a valid orientation for this robot.

    Parameters:
    orientation - The orientation to be checked.
    Returns:
    True if and only if the given orientation is one of the four following objects from the enumeration Orientation: UP, RIGHT, DOWN or LEFT.
        result == (orientation == Orientation.UP
           || orientation == Orientation.RIGHT
          || orientation == Orientation.DOWN
          || orientation == Orientation.LEFT)

    canHaveAsMaxEnergy

    public boolean canHaveAsMaxEnergy(double maxEnergy)
    Check whether the given maximum energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws], is a valid maximum energy for this robot.

    Specified by:
    canHaveAsMaxEnergy in interface IEnergyHolder
    Parameters:
    maxEnergy - The maximum energy level to be checked.
    Returns:
    False if the given maximum energy is less than the most expensive cost for an action (otherwise this robot will never be able to do that action)
        result != (maxEnergy < java.util.Collections.max(getListCosts()))
    Returns:
    False if the given energy is greater than 20000 Ws.
        result != (energy > 20000)

    Returns:

        result == (this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) / this.getMaxEnergy()) * 100

    getEnergyRequiredToReach

    public double getEnergyRequiredToReach(Position position)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                       IllegalBoardException
    Returns the minimum amount of energy, expressed in watt-second [Ws], this robot needs to move to the given position. Returns -1 if this robot cannot reach the given position. This would mean that either the robot has insufficient energy to reach the given position or the position is not reachable because of obstacles.

    Parameters:
    position - The position where to this robot may be moved to.
    Returns:
    The minimum amount of energy this robot needs to move to the given position.
        energyForPositionWithDifferingOrientation
           == {DijkstraSP(this.getBoard().createDiGraphForRobot(this), 0).distTo(thisVertices.indexOf(new OrientatedPosition(position, orientation)))
                 for all orientation in orientation.values()}
        result
           == {there exists an energy in energyForPositionWithDifferingOrientation | energy <= otherEnergy
         for all otherEnergy in energyForPositionWithDifferingOrientation}
    Returns:
    -1 if this robot robot hasn't got enough energy left to reach the given position or if the given position already contains an element
        for all orientatedPosition in {OrientatedPosition | orientatedPosition.getPosition() == position && orientatedPosition.getOrientation() !=n ull}
         if (! (this.getBoard().createListVertices(this).contains(orientatedPosition)))
         then result == -1
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this robot is terminated
        this.isTerminated()
    IllegalBoardException - [CAN] When this robot is not placed on a board.
        this.getBoard() == null

    getCostToMove

    @Basic
@Immutable
public static final double getCostToMove()
    Returns the energy cost of moving one step, expressed in Watt-second [Ws]. This method does not take into account whether a robot is carrying items or not.

    getAdditionalCostToMove

    @Basic
@Immutable
public static final double getAdditionalCostToMove()
    Returns the the additional loss of energy for each kilogram of items this robot is carrying when moving one step, expressed in Watt-second [Ws].

    getTotalCostToMove

    public double getTotalCostToMove()
    Returns the total energy cost of moving this robot one step, expressed in Watt-second [Ws]. This method takes into account the normal cost and the additional cost per kilogram of items this robot is carrying.

    Returns:
    The cost to move increased with the additional cost to move times the total weight of all the possessions this robot is carrying.
        result == Robot.getCostToMove() + Math.round(Robot.getAdditionalCostToMove() * (this.getTotalWeightPossessions()/1000))

    getPossessions

    @Basic
public java.util.List<Item> getPossessions()
    Returns a list of all the possessions this robot is carrying.

    getTotalWeightPossessions

    public int getTotalWeightPossessions()
    Returns the total weight of all the elements this robot is carrying, expressed in grams [g].

    Returns:
    The total weight of all the items this robot is carrying, expressed in kilograms [g].
        for each item in this.getPossessions(): result == result + item.getWeight()

    getIthHeaviestPossession

    public Item getIthHeaviestPossession(int index)
                              throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
    Returns the iths heaviest possession of this robot.

    Parameters:
    index - The index that indicates the ith heaviest possession.
    Returns:
    The ith heaviest possession
        result == this.getPossessions().get(index - 1)
    Throws:
    java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - [CAN] When the given index is not a valid index
        index <= 1 || index > this.getPossessions().size()

    getPossessionsString

    public java.lang.String getPossessionsString()
    Returns a string representation of all the items this robot is carrying.

    Returns:
    "/" if this robot has no possessions.
        if(this.getPossessions() == null) then result == "/"
    Returns:
    A string-list of all the items this robot possesses.
        for each item in this.getPossessions(): result == result + item.toString()

    canCarry

    public boolean canCarry(Item item)
    Checks whether this robot carry the given item.

    Parameters:
    item - The item to be checked.
    Returns:
    False if the given item is null.
        result != (item == null)
    Returns:
    False if the given item is terminated.
        result != item.isTerminated()
    Returns:
    False if the sum of the resulting weight of all the items this robot was already carrying and the weight of the given item is greater than the maximal weight this robot can carry.
        result != (this.getTotalWeightPossessions() + item.getWeight() > getMaxWeightToCarry())
    Returns:
    False when this robot is already carrying the given item.
        result ! this.getPossessions().contains(item)

    pickUp

    public void pickUp(Item item)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Picks up the given item. The item is added to the list of possessions of this robot. The item is inserted in the list of possessions based on its weight. The list of possessions of a robot is sorted on the weight of the possessions, starting with the heaviest item (index 0). The board and position of the given item are set to null.

    Parameters:
    item - The item to be picked up.
    Precondition:
    The given item must be a valid item to be picked up.
        this.canPickUp(item)
    Effect:
    The given item is added to the list of items of this robot.
        this.addItem(item)
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this robot is terminated
        this.isTerminated() || item.isTerminated()

    canPickUp

    public boolean canPickUp(Item item)
    Checks whether this robot can pick up the given item.

    Parameters:
    item - The item to be checked.
    Returns:
    False if the item cannot be added to the list of items.
        result == this.canCarry(item)
    Returns:
    False if the given item does not have a position
        result != (item.getPosition() == null)
    Returns:
    False if the position of the given item is not equal to the position of this robot.
        result != !(item.getPosition().equals(this.getPosition()))
    Returns:
    False if the given item is not standing on a board
        result != (item.getBoard() == null)
    Returns:
    False if the board on which the given item is placed is not equal to the board on which this robot is placed.
        result != !(item.getBoard() == this.getBoard())

    getMaxWeightToCarry

    @Basic
@Immutable
public static final int getMaxWeightToCarry()
    Returns the maximum weight a robot can carry.

    drop

    public void drop(Item item)
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Drops the given item. The item is removed from the list of possessions of this robot. The position of the given item is set to the position of this robot. The board on which the given item is placed is the board on which this robot is placed.

    Parameters:
    item - The item to be dropped.
    Precondition:
    The given item must be a valid item to be dropped.
        this.canDrop(item)
    Postconditions:
  • The new list of possessions of this robot does not contain the given item.
        !((new this).getPossessions().contains(item))
  • The new position of the given item is the position of this robot.
        (new item).getPosition() == this.getPostion()
  • The new board on which the given item is placed is the board on which this robot is placed.
        (new item).getBoard() == this.getBoard()
    • Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this robot is terminated
        this.isTerminated()

    canDrop

    public boolean canDrop(Item item)
    Checks whether this robot can drop the given item.

    Parameters:
    item - The item to be dropped.
    Returns:
    False if the given item is null.
        result != (item == null)

    use

    public void use(Item item)
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Use the given item.

    Parameters:
    item - The item to use.
    Precondition:
    The robot must be able to use the given item
        this.canUse(item)
    Postcondition:
    If the item is terminated after is had been used, it is removed from the list of possession of this robot.
        if((new item).isTerminated()) then !(new this).getPossessions().contains(item)
    Effect:
    The robot uses this item
        item.use(this)
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this robot is terminated
        this.isTerminated()

    canUse

    public boolean canUse(Item item)
    Checks whether the given item can be used by this robot.

    Parameters:
    item - The item to be checked
    Returns:
    False if the given item is null or terminated
        result == (item != null)
    Returns:
    The given item must be carried by this robot (this implies that it is not terminated)
        result == this.getPossessions().contains(item))

    transferItems

    public void transferItems(Robot other)
                   throws IllegalPositionException,
                          IllegalBoardException,
                          java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Transfers all the items of this robot to the given other robot if possible. If not all items can be transferred, as much items as possible are transferred.

    Parameters:
    other - The other robot that will be given the items.
    Throws:
    IllegalPositionException - [CAN] When both robots are not placed next to each other
        !this.getPosition().getAllNeighbours().contains(other.getPosition())
    IllegalBoardException - [CAN] When both robots are not placed on the same board.
        this.getBoard() != other.getBoard()
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When either this robot or the given robot is terminated
        this.isTerminated() || other.isTerminated()

    turnClockwise

    public void turnClockwise()
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Turns this robot 90 degrees in clockwise direction if the robot has sufficient energy. Does not modify the state of the robot if it has insufficient energy.

    Precondition:
    The robot must be able to turn
        this.canTurn(Direction.CLOCKWISE)
    Effects:
  • The current orientation of this robot is changed by turning 90 degrees clockwise
        this.setOrientation(this.getOrientation().turn90Clockwise())
  • The energy level of this robot is decreased with the cost of one turn
        this.setEnergy(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) - Robot.getCostToTurn())
    • Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this robot is terminated.
        this.isTerminated()

    turnCounterClockwise

    public void turnCounterClockwise()
                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Turns this robot 90 degrees in counter-clockwise direction if the robot has sufficient energy. Does not modify the state of the robot if it has insufficient energy.

    Precondition:
    The robot must be able to turn
        this.canTurn(Direction.COUNTER_CLOCKWISE)
    Effects:
  • The current orientation of this robot is changed by turning 90 degrees counter clockwise
        this.setOrientation(this.getOrientation().turn90CounterClockwise())
  • The energy level of this robot is decreased with the cost of one turn
        this.setEnergy(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) - Robot.getCostToTurn())
    • Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this robot is terminated
        this.isTerminated

    canTurn

    public boolean canTurn(Direction direction)
    Checks whether this robot is able to turn.

    Parameters:
    direction - The direction in which this robot may have to turn
    Returns:
    False if this robot does not have enough energy to turn
        result == !(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) >= Robot.getCostToTurn())
    Returns:
    False if the new orientation of this robot is not a valid orientation for a robot
        result == Robot.canHaveAsOrientation(this.getOrientation().turn90(direction)

    moveOneStep

    public void moveOneStep()
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Moves this robot one step in its current direction if the robot has sufficient energy. Does not modify the state of the robot if it has insufficient energy or if it has been terminated.

    Precondition:
    This robot must be able to move one step
        this.canMoveOneStep()
    Effects:
  • The current position is changed according to the current orientation of this robot. For example, if this robot is facing to the right, he will move one step to the right.
        this.setPosition(this.getPosition().getNeighbour(this.getOrientation()))
  • The energy level of this robot is decreased with the cost to move for this robot.
        this.setEnergy(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) - this.getTotalCostToMove())
    • Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this robot is terminated
        this.isTerminated()

    canMoveOneStep

    public boolean canMoveOneStep()
    Checks whether this robot can move one step.

    Returns:
    False if the robot is not placed on a board
        result == this.getBoard() == null
    Returns:
    False if the robot cannot be put at the new position on its board
        result == this.getBoard().canElementBePutAtPosition(this.getPosition().getNeighbour(this.getOrientation())
    Returns:
    False if the robot does not have enough energy to move one step
        result == this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) >= this.getTotalCostToMove()

    moveNextTo

    public void moveNextTo(Robot other)
                throws IllegalBoardException,
                       java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Moves this robot and the given robot as close as possible to each other consuming as little energy as possible and taking in account the current energy they have. No inefficient moves or turns are included.

    Parameters:
    other - The other robot where to this robot has to end up as close as possible (both can move!)
    Postcondition:
    Given two positions that are reachable by this robot and the given other robot (they have enough energy to reach it). Either the distance between them is greater than the distance between the new positions of this robot and the given other robot or they are not valid positions for these robots and their boards (e.g. there may be an element that conflicts with a robot) or they are equal to the new positions of this robot and the given other robot
        for each {position1 | position1 in Position && this.getEnergyRequiredToReach(position1) is in (0..this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND))} and
            {position2 | position2 in Position && other.getEnergyRequiredToReach(position2) is in (0..other.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND))}:
         ((new this).getPosition().getManhattanDistance((new other).getPosition()) <= position1.getManhattanDistance(position2)
           || ! this.getBoard().canElementBePutAtPosition(position1, this)
           || ! other.getBoard().canElementBePutAtPosition(position2, other))
           || ((new this).getPosition() == position1 && (new other).getPosition() == position2)
    Effects:
  • The energy this robot is decreased with the energy it needs to reach the position where it ends up.
        this.setEnergy(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) - this.getEnergyRequiredToReach((new this).getPosititon()))
  • The energy the given other robot is decreased with the energy it needs to reach the position where it ends up.
        other.setEnergy(other.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) - other.getEnergyRequiredToReach((new other).getPosititon()))
    • Throws:
    IllegalBoardException - [CAN] When this robot and the given other robot are not placed on the same board or they are not standing on any board.
        other.getBoard() != this.getBoard() || this.getBoard() == null || other.getBoard() == null
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this robot or the other robot are terminated
        this.isTerminated() || other.isTerminated()

    canSharePositionWith

    public boolean canSharePositionWith(Element other)
    Checks whether this robot can share a position with another element.

    Specified by:
    canSharePositionWith in class Element
    Parameters:
    other - The element where to this element may be in conflict.

    shoot

    public void shoot()
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Lets this robot shoot its laserbeam to destroy another element. One of the elements that is standing on the first position one encounters when 'walking' in a straight line from the position of the robot with its orientation, is terminated and removed from the board. If no element is standing within the shooting range of this robot, it will shoot anyway, though nothing is hit.

    Precondition:
    The robot must be able to use its laser.
        this.canShoot()
    Effect:
    The energy level of this robot is decreased with the cost of shooting one time
        this.setEnergy(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) - Robot.getCostToShoot())
    Throws:
    IllegatStateException - [CAN] When this is terminated
        this.isTerminated()
    java.lang.IllegalStateException

    canShoot

    public boolean canShoot()
    Checks whether this robot can use its laser.

    Returns:
    False if this robot is not standing on a board.
        result != (this.getBoard() == null)
    Returns:
    False if this robot does not have a position.
        result != (this.getPosition() == null)
    Returns:
    False the current amount of energy of this robot is less than the amount of energy it costs for this robot to shoot its laser.
        result != (this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) < Robot.getCostToShoot())

    takeHit

    public void takeHit()
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    When an element is hit (e.g. it is shot by a robot) some of its properties are altered. This robots maximum energy level is decreased with 4000 Ws if possible, otherwise it is terminated.

    Specified by:
    takeHit in class Element
    Effect:
    The robots maximum energy level is decreased with 4000 Ws if possible, otherwise it is terminated.
        if(this.canHaveAsMaxEnergy(this.getMaxEnergy() - 4000))
         then this.setMaxEnergy(this.getMaxEnergy() - 4000)
        else this.terminate()
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this robot is terminated.
        this.isTerminated()

    runProgramStep

    public void runProgramStep(int n)
    Runs n steps of this robots program. One step of the program means that it will run the program until a basic command (e.g. 'move')

    Parameters:
    n - The number of steps to be executed
    Effect:
    The robot will execute n steps of its program
        for i = 1..n: this.getProgram.executeStep(this)

    toString

    public java.lang.String toString()
    Returns a string representation of this robot.

    Overrides:
    toString in class Element
    Returns:
    A string of this robot.
        result == "Robot with:" + "\n"
         + super.toString() + "\n"
         + " Energy level: " + this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) + "(" + this.getEnergyFraction() + "%)" + ";  " + "\n" + " Possessions: " + this.getPossessionsString();
